author: Douglas Harding
content: You didn't need to have happened. But you did.

author: Sam Harris
content: Our lives are full of things that we are doing for the last time. Yet, usually there is no way to know you're doing it for the last time in that moment.

author: Oliver Burkeman
content: In a world geared for hurry, allowing things to take the time they take is a way to gain purchase on the world, to do the work that counts and to derive satisfaction from doing itself instead of deferring all fulfilment to the future.

author: Marcus Aurelius
content: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.

author: Seneca
content: We suffer more in imagination than in reality.

author: Epictetus
content: It is not death or pain that is to be feared, but the fear of pain or death.

author: Zeno of Citium
content: The two elements of happiness are: something to do, and someone to love.
